title: Ticket #5112: *LoadAvg does not work on Fedora 22
description:
As first reported by Roderick Johnstone (https://www-auth.cs.wisc.edu/lists/htcondor-users/2015-June/msg00070.shtml), the startd appears to not properly detect the LoadAvg and CondorLoadAvg attributes on Fedora 22. The offending line appears to be:

06/19/15 17:23:13 /proc format unknown for kernel version 4.0.4

The end result is that START expressions that use *LoadAvg do not evaluate as expected. Sample output from a Fedora 22 instance running HTCondor 8.3.1: 

condor_status -af Name CondorLoadAvg LoadAvg
slot1@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot2@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot3@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot4@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot5@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot6@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot7@normal.lan -1.0 0.0
slot8@normal.lan -1.0 -1.0
[746 root@normal ~ ]$
remarks:
2015-Jun-22 14:50:06 by tim:
Duplicate of #5080
creator: bcotton
